lead_paragraph: PATTERSON--Patricia. Patricia Shephard Patterson, passed away peacefully in Palm Beach, Florida surrounded by her loving family on Mother's Day, May 8th following a long illness. She was born in San Francisco on June 29th, 1925. Shortly after graduating from Stanford University in 1947, Patricia and her sister, Geraldine, moved to New York City. In 1958 she married Bruce A. Norris, owner of the Detroit Red Wings. Together they had a daughter, Wendy Norris, who they cherished. They divorced in 1967. In April, 1970 she married Herbert Patterson, then President of Chase Manhattan Bank. In the late 1970's Patricia began a long and esteemed career in Real Estate. As Vice President of Sotheby's International Realty in Manhattan she was a top producer. Clients became friends, her friends became clients and her career turned into her passion. Pat actively and continuously dedicated herself to making the world a better place for others. She worked tirelessly with boards, commissions and volunteer organizations. She was noted for her work as a Board Member of The Boys Club of New York, The School of American Ballet, International Committee of the Museum of Modern Art, The Venetian Heritage, The Central Park Conservancy, The Junior League and The Parish Art Museum. Traveling the world was one of Patricia's many passions. She loved exploring museums, galleries, cathedrals and diverse cultures. She was a passionate collector and supporter of the arts. Her most precious memories were the times she was able to share her life's journeys with friends and family. She was an avid sportswoman, proficient in many sports. Pat spent many happy days competing at her favorite Clubs, including The Meadow Club, Lyford Cay Club and the Everglades Club. Weekends were always spent either enjoying lunch on the porch at The Bathing Corporation or Sunday night dinners at Piping Rock. Holidays were spent at The Colony Club and The River Club. Patricia Patterson is survived by her daughter Wendy Norris Grant and her grandson Bruce Norris Grant. She was predeceased by her sister Geraldine Shephard. Patricia Patterson's funeral will be private. A Memorial will be held in New York City in September and Palm Beach in the winter. An announcement will follow. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made in her memory to The Boys Club of New York, The School of American Ballet, The Central Park Conservancy, and The Venetian Heritage. 1/3
